subject: Ethics
title: Polluter Pays Principle
description: A short lesson to help you apply Polluter Pays Principle.

hook.text: A factory dumps waste into a river. Townspeople get sick. Who should pay for the cleanup?

buildup.text: The polluter pays principle says whoever causes environmental damage should bear the cost of fixing it.

discovery.text: The OECD adopted this principle in 1972. It's now embedded in EU law and many international treaties.

twist.text: In practice, companies pass costs to consumers through higher prices. The polluter paysâ€”with your wallet.

climax.text: And when a polluter goes bankrupt, taxpayers foot the bill anyway. The principle has a loophole problem.

punchline.text: In theory, polluters pay. In practice, you do.

quiz.question: What does the polluter pays principle state?
options: Governments should always pay for environmental cleanups
Consumers are responsible for all pollution costs
Whoever causes environmental damage should bear the cost of fixing it
